Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Louis Straker, Reflections Church located at 1078 Utica Avenue, Brooklyn NY 11203.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Louis.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Louis Straker, Reflections Church located at 1078 Utica Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11203.

Council Member Louis moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of August 15, 2024 be adopted as printed by Council Member Ariola.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Ariola moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of August 15, 2024 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Items.AgendaNote: COMMUNICATIONS FROM CITY, COUNTY & BOROUGH OFFICES - None

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Holden:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 19-160.2 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving a sidewalk café located at 6001 70th Avenue, Ridgewood, NY 11358, Borough of Queens, Council District 30, Community District 5, related to Application No. D 2450082809 SWQ (Cozy Corner Bar), shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Cozy Corner Bar, Queens (D 2450082809 SWQ).

Items.Title:
By The Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca) 
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 19-160.2 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving a sidewalk café located at 640 Prospect Avenue, Bronx, NY 10455, Borough the Bronx, Council District 17, Community District 2, related to Application No. D 2450065822 SWX (Seis Vecinos Restaurant), shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Seis Vecinos Restaurant, Bronx (D 2450065822 SWX).

Items.Title:
By Council Member Bottcher: 
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Application No. C 240244 ZSM (343 West 47th Street Demolition Special Permit) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 343 West 47th Street Demolition Special Permit, Manhattan (C 240244 ZSM).

Items.Title:
By The Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca) 
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Application Nos. C 230208 ZSM and C 230209 ZSM (135th Street Rezoning) shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related to Application Nos. C 230206 ZMM and N 230207 ZRM.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Call-Up was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 135th Street Rezoning, Manhattan (C 230208 ZSM and C 230209 ZSM).

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a New York city freedom trail task force
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a New York city freedom trail task force.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to studying the impacts of slavery and its legacies in New York city and recommending potential reparative measures for resulting harms
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Studying the impacts of slavery and its legacies in New York city and recommending potential reparative measures for resulting harms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a truth, healing, and reconciliation process
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: The creation of a truth, healing, and reconciliation process.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the installation and maintenance of an informational sign at the intersection of Wall and Pearl Streets in Manhattan to mark the site of New York’s first slave market
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the installation and maintenance of an informational sign at the intersection of Wall and Pearl Streets in Manhattan to mark the site of New York’s first slave market.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing Landing Day in the second week of September annually to commemorate the arrival of the first Jewish community in New Amsterdam in 1654 and to celebrate the continuing importance of the Jewish community in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing Landing Day in the second week of September annually to commemorate the arrival of the first Jewish community in New Amsterdam in 1654.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Consumer warnings regarding rifles, shotguns, and firearms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of pet dealers and prohibiting the sale of dogs and cats in retail pet stores, and to repeal section 17-1706 of such code, relating to the exemptions for shelter and rescue partners
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Regulation of pet dealers and prohibiting the sale of dogs and cats in retail pet stores, and to repeal section 17-1706 of such code, relating to the exemptions for shelter and rescue partners.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Reporting and publication of mental health emergency response data.

Items.Title: Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 2153, Lot 1; Block 2162, Lot 1) Manhattan, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 142).

Items.MatterName: LU 142 - Rachel Bridge HDFC, Block 2153, Lot 1; Block 2162, Lot 1, Manhattan, Community District No. 12, Council District No. 10.

Items.MatterName: Replacement of the individual responsible for implementing certain duties of the commissioner of investigation relating to the police department and reporting on investigations relating to the police department.

Items.MatterName: DOI to conduct an investigation to ascertain the knowledge possessed by mayoral administrations on environmental toxins produced by the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center and to submit a report to the Council thereon.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Suspension of alternate side parking regulations on Patriot Day.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Providing local community boards and elected officials with advance notice of planned street closures.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare

Items.MatterName: Requiring that people in the custody and staff of the DOC have access to gender-affirming items and medical devices.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: New York Slavery Era Business and State Procurement Act (S.7738)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R.8525, also known as the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act, to hold law enforcement accountable for misconduct in court, improve transparency through data collection, and reform police training and policies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: The George Floyd Justice in Policing Act (H.R.8525).

Items.Title: Resolution Calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign S.7591/A.7920, to amend the state finance law, in relation to establishing and funding a universal basic income pilot program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Establishing and funding a universal basic income pilot program (S.7591/A.7920).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, H.R. 40, which establishes the Commission to Study and Develop Reparation Proposals for African Americans Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Establishes the Commission to Study and Develop Reparation Proposals for African Americans Act (H.R. 40).

Items.Title: Resolution designating January 12 annually as Sheila Jackson Lee Appreciation Day in the City of New York to recognize her contributions as a highly effective 15-term Congresswoman, who was a forceful and skillful advocate for civil rights and progressive causes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Designating January 12 annually as Sheila Jackson Lee Appreciation Day in the City of New York to recognize her contributions as a highly effective 15-term Congresswoman, who was a forceful and skillful advocate for civil rights and progressive causes.

Items.Title: Application number C 230206 ZMM (135th Street Rezoning) submitted by Crosscap Holdings, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 5c, changing from an M1-1 District to an R7-2 District, establishing within the proposed R7-2 District a C2-4 District, and establishing a Special Manhattanville Mixed Use District (MMU), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 9, Council District 7.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 135th Street Rezoning, Manhattan (C 230206 ZMM).

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 49 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, September 26, 2024.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
